## 1. Text & Inline hotlink references

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

## 2. Tables

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## 3. Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

## 7. Figures

```{r figures, fig.height=5 , fig.align='center'}
x = rnorm(100)
plot(x, col=3, pch=19)

```

## 8. Figures no code

```{r figures no code, fig.height=5 , fig.align='center', echo=FALSE}
x = rnorm(100)
plot(x, col=3, pch=19)

```

## 9. Using cache=FALSE the first time it will run slow (delay for 10 seconds)

```{r longtime, cache=FALSE}
Sys.sleep(10)

```

## 10. Using cache=TRUE the second time it will run fast (recompile)

```{r longtime2, cache=TRUE}
Sys.sleep(10)

```

## 11. Session Info & Date

```{r session info}
sessionInfo()
# BiocManager::install("devtools")

devtools::session_info()
Sys.Date()

```
